Class Soliton

java.lang.Object
  Soliton

public class Soliton
extends java.lang.Object

Object of a parameterized robust soliton probability distribution, ready for sampling.

Author:
Jose Lopes

Field Summary
private  double beta
          Normalization factor for the robust soliton distribution.
private  double delta
          Admissible failure probability.
private  int k
          Number of blocks to be encoded.
private  double R
          Parameter used for the tau function.
 
Constructor Summary
Soliton(int k, double c, double delta)
          Creates new Soliton distribution object, according to the received parameters.
 
Method Summary
 int getBlocksNeeded()
          Calculates the number of encoded packets required at the receiving end to ensure that the decoding can run to completion, with probability at least 1-delta.
private  double mu(int i)
          Robust soliton distribution.
private  double rho(int i)
          Ideal soliton distribution.
 int soliton(long seed)
          Samples the robust soliton distribution.
private  double tau(int i)
          Extra set of values to the elements of mass function of the ideal soliton distribution.

Constructor Detail

Soliton

public Soliton(int k,
               double c,
               double delta)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates new Soliton distribution object, according to the received parameters.

Parameters:
k - Number of blocks to be encoded.
c - Constant.
delta - Admissible failure probability.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - In case k<=0, c<=0 or delta not in [0,1]

i - Argument for the probability mass function.

soliton

public int soliton(long seed)
            throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
Samples the robust soliton distribution.

Returns:
Random degree number, according to the robust soliton probability distribution.
Throws:
java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - In case i is not in [1..k].

getBlocksNeeded

public int getBlocksNeeded()
Calculates the number of encoded packets required at the receiving end to ensure that the decoding can run to completion, with probability at least 1-delta.

Returns:
The number of encoded packets required at the receiving end to ensure that the decoding can run to completion, with probability at least 1-delta.
